books.title: The Virginian
books.author: Owen Wister
books.summary: A cowboy working on a Wyoming Territory cattle ranch in the 1880s embraces the spirit of the American West.

books.title: Sir Percy Hits Back
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A young woman doing a good deed is inadvertently caught up in the injustice of the French Revolution.

books.title: Confessions of an English Opium-Eater
books.author: Thomas De Quincey
books.summary: A portrait of the life of a drug addict in Georgian-era London.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: Dorothy and the Wizard in Oz
books.author: L. Frank Baum
books.summary: A young girl and her companions travel through dangerous underground realms with the help of an old friend.

books.title: The Seagull
books.author: Anton Chekhov
books.summary: A has-been actress, her ambitious playwright son, a male writer, and an aspiring young actress struggle to realize their romantic and artistic aims.

books.title: Romeo and Juliet
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: The children of two opposing houses fall in love.

books.title: The Demi-Gods
books.author: James Stephens
books.summary: Three demi-gods descend among humanity in the form of angels, stumbling upon a father, his daughter, and their donkey traveling around rural Ireland.

books.title: The Council of Justice
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: The Four Just Men match wits with the Red Hundred, an anarchist group bent on raising havoc in Britain.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.summary: An ancient undead monster terrorizes Victorian London.

books.title: Commentaries on the Gallic War
books.author: Julius Caesar
books.summary: Julius Caesar’s account of the conflicts between Rome and Gaul in the later years of the Roman republic.

books.title: Unnatural Death
books.author: Dorothy L. Sayers
books.summary: An amateur detective’s investigation of the suspiciously-early death of an elderly lady triggers a series of deadly events.

books.title: The New State
books.author: Mary Parker Follett
books.summary: The theory of group organization is formulated and applied in an attempt to design a truly democratic political state.

books.title: Mutual Aid
books.author: Peter Kropotkin
books.summary: Kropotkin explores the role of cooperation in animal societies and human societies, past and present, and how it could benefit modern society.

books.title: Pan Tadeusz
books.author: Adam Mickiewicz
books.summary: A young nobleman explores romance, feuding families, politics, and national identity during a period of social upheaval and Russian occupation.

books.title: Where Angels Fear to Tread
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: After an English widow on holiday impetuously falls in love with a handsome young Tuscan, her panicked in-laws send a rescue party.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Robert Sheckley
books.summary: A collection of science fiction and fantasy stories by Robert Sheckley ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Ernest Hemingway
books.summary: A collection of Ernest Hemingway’s short stories and novellas.

books.title: Festus
books.author: Philip James Bailey
books.summary: A man goes on a quest for knowledge, truth, and understanding in the face of the complexities of existence and spirituality.

books.title: The Path to Rome
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a walking pilgrimage to Rome from his hometown in France, writing of the journey, sketching the sights, and digressing on a wide variety of subjects.
